displaytitle: Entrance to the Dressing Rooms (Gakuya-iri 楽屋入り) (left) & Reconstruction (Itakakoi 板囲ひ) (right), from the series “Annual Events of the Theater in Edo” (Ō-Edo shibai nenjū gyōji 大江戸しばゐねんぢうぎやうじ)
medium: Woodblock print (ōban yoko-e format); ink and color on paper
dimensions:
sheet (left (entrance)): 23.9 × 36.2 cm (9 7/16 × 14 1/4 in.)
sheet (right (reconstruction)): 24.3 × 36.5 cm (9 9/16 × 14 3/8 in.)
creditline: Allen R. Adler, Class of 1967, Japanese Print Collection
markings:
A. Entrance to the Dressing Rooms (Gakuya-iri 楽屋入り) (left)
Cartouches
1. On indigo & white banner, upper right:
	Circle in center – 3 lines of script (r>l):
	大江戸
	???
	志むゐ
2. Kana & kanji inscription on opened handscroll form, center to left, top:
	樂屋入り (followed by 9+ lines of text, annotated [Japanese pronunciation]
3. Printer’s inscription (red) in lower half of left margin: 2 lines above, one below:
	明至卅年     月     日印刷仝年仝月
	東京市 京橋區南傳馬町二丁目十七番地
	臨寫印刷兼發行者  長谷川 壽美
4. 2 small square printed (red) seals below printer’s inscription (#3):
	intaglio seal: 宮組
	relief seal:  言正

B. Reconstruction (Itakakoi 板囲ひ) (right)
Cartouches
1. On indigo & white banner, upper right:
	Circle in center – 3 lines of script (r>l):
	大江戸
	???
	志むゐ
2. Kana & kanji inscription on opened handscroll form, center to left, top:
	板囲ひ (followed by 9+ lines of text plus postscript, annotated [Japanese pronunciation]
3. Printer’s inscription (red) in lower half of left margin: 2 lines above, one below:
	明至卅年     月     日印刷仝年
	東京市 京稿區南傳馬町二丁目十七番地
	臨寫印刷兼發行者  長谷川 壽美
4. Blue banners with white characters (r>l/near>far): 
	(one under indigo banner, part of last 字visible): 具
	大道具
	中村座
	大仕?
	長谷川
	大道具 
5. Placard propped against wall of theater, at lower left margin; with 3 lines of text; right margin 
	has: 口上
6. 2 small square printed (red) seals below printer’s inscription (#3):
	intaglio seal: [  ] 組
	relief seal:  [  ] 正

titles.title: Entrance to the Dressing Rooms (Gakuya-iri 楽屋入り) (left) & Reconstruction (Itakakoi 板囲ひ) (right), from the series “Annual Events of the Theater in Edo” (Ō-Edo shibai nenjū gyōji 大江戸しばゐねんぢうぎやうじ)

makers.displaymaker: Adachi Ginkō 安達吟光, active 1874–1897

texts.textentryhtml:
–2008 Collection of Ruth Leserman (Los Angeles, CA) and Allen R. Adler (New York, NY), co-ownership.
2008 Allen R. Adler (New York, NY), by gift to the Princeton University Art Museum, 2008.

displaymaker: Adachi Ginkō 安達吟光, active 1874–1897 | Published by Hasegawa Toshiyoshi
caption: Japanese, Meiji era (1868–1912), Adachi Ginkō 安達吟光 (active 1874–1897), Published by Hasegawa Toshiyoshi, Entrance to the Dressing Rooms (Gakuya-iri 楽屋入り) (left) & Reconstruction (Itakakoi 板囲ひ) (right), from the series “Annual Events of the Theater in Edo” (Ō-Edo shibai nenjū gyōji 大江戸しばゐねんぢうぎやうじ), 1897 [Meiji 30]. Woodblock print (ōban yoko-e format); ink and color on paper; 23.9 × 36.2 cm (sheet, left (entrance)), 24.3 × 36.5 cm (sheet, right (reconstruction)). Allen R. Adler, Class of 1967, Japanese Print Collection (2008-96 a-b)
